intro: Cynanchum viminale subsp. welwitschii, commonly known as the slender milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas. The plant features slender, climbing stems that can reach several meters in length. Its flowers are small, greenish-yellow, and clustered in racemes, while the leaves are opposite and ovate. The species is notable for its milky sap, which is characteristic of many members of the Asclepiadaceae family.
